titlestmt.titleproper: Finding aid for the Mack family (Evanston, Ill.) papers

profiledesc.creation: Encoded finding aid created from MARC record by Dallas Pillen
profiledesc.langusage: The finding aid is written in English

descgrp.accessrestrict: The collection is open for research use.

archdesc.bioghist: Edward E. Mack was a 1917 graduate of the University of Michigan. During World War I, he served as a 1st lieutenant with the 52nd Artillery. His wife Eleanor Mack lived in Evanston, Illinois during the war.
archdesc.scopecontent: Letters exchanged while Edward was in the service. The letters describe daily events and reflect their love and affection for each other. The collection also includes letters from Edward to his parents and other family memebrs about his war-time experiences.
